item.title: Something Extraordinary
item.description: The high-strung Belle has left behind her heroine era, and the drama-prone Rufus has left behind his Sir Horley Comewithers era.

item.title: Experienced
item.description: Bette gets dumped-but-not-dumped in truly shitty fashion by her girlfriend, who suggests she just needs more experience since she’s newly out as a lesbian.

item.title: Hanami
item.description: The art is beautiful! The story is stressful. I have known various people in my life where, let’s just say their enthusiasm for an idea exceeds their preparation for the reality of it.

item.title: How to Fall for a Scoundrel
item.description: A thief and a private investigator team up to solve a theft, and the vibes are basically a case-of-the-week tv episode (think Charlie’s Angels, Remington Steele, White Collar, etc) playing historical dress-up.

item.title: I’ll Have What He’s Having
item.description: I’m glad the term tonic masculinity has been making the rounds, because this feels like tonic masculinity of the highest order.

item.title: Origin Story
item.description: If I had to comp this title, it’s like when I discovered Matt Dean, a talented writer self-publishing better litfic than 80% of the market, yet in a way that would earn rejections from most if not all of the big 5 and their imprints, as it’s not easily marketable as one thing or another.

item.title: Our History Is the Future
item.description: An excellent re-issue of a book that’s been on my to-read list since it first published in 2019. I’m glad it finally prompted me to get to it.
